I would end it. He sounds emotionally immature and if he sets a deadline in your relationship that‚Äôs a major red flag. Clearly he was commitment issues. My ex was like this, and though it lasted 3 years, we were always on and off and he cheated a lot. Don‚Äôt involve yourself in something that‚Äôs already so messy. You‚Äôre young and you deserve better
For the intern too, it is a lot easier and less intimidating to connect with someone who‚Äôs the similar age when new at a company. I‚Äôve been there.

It‚Äôs extremely normal for employees to chat, get coffee with, etc. interns. Interns need to socialize not just about work but gain a perspective on what life may be like at the company therefor it makes sense that they‚Äôre talking / going out to coffee. I wouldn‚Äôt worry about the age difference. It‚Äôs 3 years, which is small and she‚Äôs not underage so that part shouldn‚Äôt bother you. It‚Äôs normal to be a little jealous, but it‚Äôs not something you need to fight him against. It sounds professional and he has told you about it so it‚Äôs not like he is hiding anything. Trust him. And if you don‚Äôt, there are bigger problems than him getting coffee with an intern/future colleague.

Hi honey. I‚Äôm so sorry you‚Äôre feeling this way. It sounds a little irrational since he hasn‚Äôt done anything to lose your trust or similar nature. I think that when people are insecure single, it intensifies and complicates relationships when you‚Äôre seeing someone. Take some time to assure YOURSELF. you don‚Äôt need hiss reassurance or complements to change anything. This is within you. You should know you are enough, and if he is staying with you, he does love you. I know it can be tough not to get jealous if he follows some insta models, but he is a human being after all and has the right to find other women attractive - that doesn‚Äôt mean he wants them more or finds you less attractive! Be confident in yourself and the relationship, and things will fall into place. People come and go all the time, that‚Äôs how life works. Instead of living in fear, life with confidence in the present. He‚Äôs with you, he loves you. And if college changes that, then it wasn‚Äôt meant to be. The best thing to do is regain confidence in yourself.
